bug.author: atomsk121
bug.summary: Getting "Module not found error" when attempting to import user package
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Getting "Module not found error" when attempting to import user package. Printed out a statement from the module in file I run using streamlit to prove that there is no problem regularly. Ran streamlit - Got module not found error. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Create custom package Import in streamlit file. Use a module from the package to ensure that there is no problem with the package itself. Run streamlit app.
Example: `import streamlit as st from dashboard_layer.freq_enums import frequency_enum if name == 'main': print(frequency_enum.freqsAll_mt.value)` <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Value printed out. Streamlit runs as it should - No error. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Value printed out. Streamlit: Using relative import <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65228616/88782108-de695a00-d195-11ea-8e83-4dd9beff4813.png></denchmark-link>
Using regular import: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65228616/88782265-0e186200-d196-11ea-9c49-205bda5a4238.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
No <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.64.0 Python version: Python 3.8.3 Using Pip OS version: Windows 10 Browser version: Google chrome Version 84.0.4147.89 (Official Build) (64-bit)
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
